intro: Calycosia milnei, commonly known as the white thistle, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are white to pale purple, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets. Calycosia milnei is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
